citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
*Multiple dogs at the facility are heavily matted and in need of grooming. These dogs include:
Shitzu’s: “Faith” #080; “Hope” #81; and “Pansy” #6
Poodles: “Duffy” #74 and “Teddy” # 49
Bichons: “Racquette and “Polo”.
Matted fur pulls and separates from the skin which can be potentially painful and cause skin irritations. Additionally,
matted fur does not allow the fur to insulate the dog against cold temperatures. These dogs must be groomed on a routine
basis to prevent this matting from occurring and for the well being of the dogs.
*A King Charles Cavalier “Kenny” had dirty ears a strong noxious odor in the ears which could indicate an infection. This
dog should have his ears cleaned on a routine basis to prevent reoccurring ear issues for his comfort and well-being.
Correct by: April 27, 2024

An enclosure in the middle of the kennel housing a female and her puppies needs to be addressed. The right front corner
is not connected between two sides and there is a small gap and a screw that is protruding into the enclosure at eye level
with the puppies. This gap and screw pose a potential injury hazard to the dogs. This enclosure must be maintained in
good repair for the safety of the dogs.
Correct by: April 19, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
A whelping enclosure is not being spot cleaned daily and there is an accumulation of feces and shavings that needs to be
removed. Enclosures must be spot cleaned daily to prevent soiling of the dogs and to reduce odors and disease hazards.
This is especially important when deworming puppies to remove feces daily that may contain parasites. This needs to be
addressed for the health of the dogs.
Correct by: April 19, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Housekeeping around the kennel needs to be addressed. These include:
An accumulation of weeds along the outside wall of the enclosures that is not being controlled.
Multiple trash items (old carpet squares, metal siding, plastic bags) are discarded on the ground around the kennel
contributing to a cluttered area.
Facilities and grounds must be kept clean, free of accumulations of trash, and weeds must be controlled to reduce living
areas for pests and to facilitate good housekeeping practices.
Correct by: May 10, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
